div.p: We received your letter written on April 21st on April 23rd; we understand what you write about Gachlinger. As we have heard these days, he is the same as he was before. - Your weakness troubles us; you seem to us to be advised by these words of Erasmus:

"Unless the vine is pruned from time to time, it becomes weak and perishes by its own fertility; thus, excessive zeal must be restrained in fortunate talents, lest they be exhausted by insufficiently moderate labor."
We therefore ask you by the Lord, not to kill yourself with excessive zeal nor to wear out Bullinger, but rather to preserve this man for the world.
